PM2.5.description: Fine particulate matter can penetrate deep into the lungs and affect heart and lung health.
PM2.5.recommendation: Avoid outdoor activities, wear a protective mask, and use an air purifier indoors.

PM10.description: Coarse particles can cause respiratory irritation.
PM10.recommendation: Limit prolonged exposure outdoors if you have respiratory conditions.

NO2.description: Nitrogen dioxide can irritate the airways and affect lung function.
NO2.recommendation: Reduce exposure during heavy traffic hours and consider indoor air purification.

O3.description: Ozone at ground level can cause respiratory issues and worsen asthma.
O3.recommendation: Avoid strenuous outdoor activities during high ozone periods.

CO.description: Carbon monoxide can reduce oxygen delivery in the body and is particularly dangerous in high concentrations.
CO.recommendation: Ensure proper ventilation indoors and avoid areas with heavy traffic.
